intro: Garnotia panicoides, commonly known as the panicled garnotia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Garnotia panicoides is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
